intro: Mascagnia rubra, commonly known as the scarlet trumpetflower, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking red tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and lance-shaped, while its flowers are clustered in terminal umbels. Mascagnia rubra thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
